item.title: Report X-2023081076
item.description:
Report X-2023081076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: AUGUSTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package arrive to truck and notice he could not scan barcode. called a QA to come over to inspect and notice that label was wet. QA manager came over and took pkg to hazmat cage. Notice top was not all of the way on pail. DescribePack: not a big leakage but top is not properly fitted on pail DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: taking to hazmat cage and placed in drum

item.title: Report E-2023080397
item.description:
Report E-2023080397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the poly 5 gallon pails of endurastrip (un1760) had been damaged by other freight and had released 10 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080255
item.description:
Report E-2023080255

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 24, 2023, three (3) 55-gallon drums of sodium chlorite were damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew identified the pallet of damaged drums and secured the drums in three (3) 95-gallon overpack drums. HES deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor and worked them in with hand tools. All clean up debris and PPE were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080208
item.description:
Report E-2023080208

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2023, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental (HE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HE personnel collected three (3) damaged bags of UN3378 for disposal. Crews then utilized hand tools to collect the free product. The undamaged freight was re-stacked and secured for normal transport. All UN3378 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080202
item.description:
Report E-2023080202

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of ink was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental (HE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN1210 for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted dock floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1210 was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080079
item.description:
Report E-2023080079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, two (2) 50-gallon drums of cinnamyl nitril (UN3278) were leaking from the bungs and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew them utilized hand tools to containerize all UN3278-impacted material in one (1) 5-gallon bucket.
